titleInfo.title: "The Second Elder," poem by John Trotwood Moore

mods.abstract: The poem, printed in the Nashville Tennessean, recounts a dramatized version of Sergeant York's taking of the German machine gun position. The poem makes numerous biblical references as well as listing other prominent Tennessee military figures, including Andrew Jackson, David Crockett, John Sevier, and others.

relatedItem.abstract: Alvin Cullum York (1887-1964) was one of the most decorated soldiers of the First World War. A recipient of the Medal of Honor and the French Legion of Honour, York is considered one of the greatest of Tennesseeâ€™s native sons...
